text: Cant go wrong with this brewery most beers are outstanding quality pale ale are always smooth and tasty

Bottle. It pours hazy golden with a creamy white head. Piney and tropical fruity hoppy aroma with lingering smooth malty notes. Oranges and grass. Great tropical fruity flavor with citrus and stone fruits and creamy malty notes. Light hay and passion fruit. Brilliant.

Bottle @ Craft Covent Garden. Hazy deep gold with a small pour. Nose has a lot going on. Grape jellies and mild citrus. A bit of cow patch earthiness. Cut grass. Flavor starts a bit juicy and sweet before drying out to a very grassy, chalky finish. Grape and white pepper. Light body, prickly carb. Great.

Bottle 
Unfortunately its a bit old bottled in February. Would like to rerate if possible. Pours bright orange hue with a small rocky soapy white head and sparse lacing. Nose is floral citric and slightly oxidized. Im sure this was a very bright beer when fresh. Citric slightly astringent hop flavors . Long big citric bitterness on the finish with lingering pale malt husks. The hop combination would have been great when fresh.

Bottle from We Brought Beer, split with the Mrs in London (9/4/2016) - amber pour with white head. Fruity and malty aroma and taste sporting a plethora of citrus and tropical fruits, some mandarin, lemon, mango, pine and nice grassy hoppy action, goes down a treat.

15th March 2016Light haze on this gold beer, tidy pale cream colour head. Smooth palate. Nice malt base, a little soft and with mild creamy sweetness. Nice juicy Nelson Sauvin grape and mild gooseberry. Smooth pine. Mild marmalade and orange peel. A whisper of hop skunk. Smooth semi dry finish. Nice medley of hoppy smoothness.

Bottle from Ales By Mail. Pours hazy Golden with a nice creamy 1 inch white head . Aroma is strong, like a tropical fruit orchard with mango, melon, juicy oranges and even some flowery notes. Taste is juicy light sweet fruits, easy drinking like nectar, leaves the mouth clean with a delicious minty afterburn, very good beer from Kernel.

Bottle from Whole Foods PiccyD. It pours hazy amber with a decent white head. The nose is soft, fresh, sweet, gooey, peach, stewed orange, nectarine, melon and brioche. The taste is smooth, bitter, orange peel, melon, nectarine, peach, papaya, earth, leafy/grassy notes, light spice and bread with a dry, slightly peppery finish. Medium body and soft, massaging carbonation. Absolutely classic Kernel pale ale gear. Well rounded and juicy.

Bottle. Whole Foods Market, Piccadilly, London. Murky, grey tinged gold. Film and a few bubbles of white head. Nose has notes of fresh pineapple. Peach flesh. Some grape and melon. Very fresh and bright. Taste is fruity, juicy, soft bitter. Some biscuit sweetness. Lovely mouthfeel. Soft and juicy. Fruity bitter finish, that gets nicely zesty toward the end. Great stuff.

330ml bottle at home in Richmond as The Kernel Pale Ale Nelson Sauvin Columbus Chinook, 5.4%, bottled about 6 weeks ago. Pale orange, slight haze, foamy white head. Aroma is dried tangerine peel, white pepper, sugar syrup. Body is smooth, soft carbonation, a little foamy. Taste is pine, a little guava, wet grass, melon, not particularly bitter. The balance here is pretty exceptional. Not the type of beer that would shine at a big tasting, but a great one to smash back a few bottles of.

Bottle. Hazy bronze body with a medium white head. Lively carbonation. Good lacing. Aroma of white grape, orange pith and flower petals. Flavour of grapefruit, lemon and a dry, slightly peppery finish. Thin to medium body with a very oily mouthfeel. Soft fizz. Fresh and hoppy - bottled just five weeks ago. I think its the first Kernel Pale Ale Ive had from a 330ml bottle.

Bottle at home, 07/03/16.
Hazed golden orange with a well appointed off white covering.
Nose is mango pulp, orange pith, melon drool, toasted malt, soft bread dough.
Taste comprises tangerine, juicy melon, hop jus, mango, light grapefruit, citric pith, soft bread, subtle mineral wash.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a juicy hop scrub.
Solid well balanced flavoursome APA ... top draw Kernel fayre.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle from Cotteridge Wines and drunk at home. Hazy amber lasting white head. Lovely zesty aroma. Rather lovely flavour too. Zesty citrus. Some bitterness. Soft carbonation. I mean this is a rather fantastic pale ale. Great fruit. Stunning. Zingy and lovely.
Tap at Craft Islington, 2nd March 16. Poured slightly hazy, light hay. Aroma is super floral, citrus, great. Taste is clean, citrus, slight pine, floral, refreshing. Excellent

Keg at CBC Islington - London. Pours clear gold with a light, foamy white head. Super juicy aroma, with lots of melon, papaya, mango, tangerine. Light-medium sweet with mild pale bread, buckets more vibrant and juicy hop character, citrus and tropical varieties, light grassy bitterness. Light bodied with average carbonation. Great balance on the finish, more melon, pithy grapefruit, dry pale malts, light hay, melon, papaya. Superlative stuff.
